#Text=4 .
#Text=Simulation Results
#Text=The proposed AKSD and the conventional KSD were tested with various values of K for comparison .
#Text=The improved K-best SD ( IKSD ) algorithm was also considered for comparison .
#Text=In , three threshold rules were proposed , namely , the adaptive , normalized , and fixed thresholds .
#Text=In this study , for comparison , we tested the adaptive threshold-based IKSD and the fixed threshold-based IKSD .
#Text=In addition , the schemes in were tested for comparison .

#Text=The radius adaptive K -best decoder ( RAKSD ) in employs tree decomposition and adaptive pruning to reduce the complexity , whereas the dynamic threshold-aided K -best sphere decoder ( DKSD ) in exploits a dynamic threshold to adjust K .
#Text=For the threshold in the proposed AKSD algorithm , the constant was set to 1 .
#Text=For the initial radius , we set , as in .
#Text=The complexity was measured by the average number of visited nodes .
#Text=Furthermore , the mean values in the simulation results were obtained by averaging over independent channel realizations .
#Text=For simulations , we considered two large MIMO configurations : and .
#Text=In
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=, the BER comparison results for a MIMO system with , , and 16-QAM are shown .
#Text=We can observe that the AKSD scheme with relatively small K achieves comparable or better BER performance with respect to the conventional KSD scheme with large K .

#Text=Specifically , the performance of the proposed AKSD with is nearly the same as that of the conventional KSD with at high SNRs , where the AKSD achieves an SNR gain of 0.7 dB over the conventional KSD with at BER .
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=also shows that the AKSD scheme achieves better BER performance compared to the adaptive threshold-based IKSD and fixed threshold-based IKSD .
#Text=The SNR gains of the AKSD at BER over the adaptive threshold-based IKSD with and the fixed threshold-based IKSD with are approximately dB and dB , respectively .
#Text=Moreover , the AKSD scheme outperforms both the RAKSD and DKSD by approximately dB and dB , respectively , at a BER of .
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=compares the BER performance for , , and 16-QAM .
#Text=Similar to
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=, it demonstrates that the AKSD scheme achieves nearly the same BER performance with that of the conventional KSD scheme with larger K at high SNRs .
#Text=It is also worth noting that the proposed AKSD outperforms the fixed threshold-based IKSD with , achieving an approximate SNR gain of dB for BER .
#Text=In
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=, it is also observed that the AKSD scheme substantially outperforms the DKSD and RAKSD schemes .
#Text=In
#Text=Figure 3
#Text=, the complexity comparison for a MIMO system with and 16-QAM is shown .
#Text=Figure 3
#Text=shows that the RAKSD scheme requires lower complexity than the other compared schemes ; however , its BER performance is significantly worse than those of the other schemes , as shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=.
#Text=A similar observation can also be made for the DKSD scheme .
#Text=Figure 3
#Text=also shows that the proposed scheme requires lower complexity than the other schemes providing comparable BER performances .

#Text=Specifically , the complexity-reduction ratio of the AKSD at SNR = 20 dB , compared with the conventional KSD with is approximately , whereas they achieve comparable BER performance , as shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=.
#Text=Furthermore , the AKSD scheme provides and complexity savings compared with the fixed threshold-based IKSD and the adaptive threshold-based IKSD , respectively .
#Text=We note that the AKSD scheme outperforms the fixed threshold-based IKSD and adaptive threshold-based IKSD in terms of BER performance .
#Text=In
#Text=Figure 3
#Text=, it is also observed that the complexity reduction of the proposed scheme becomes larger as the SNR increases .

#Text=This is because , in the high-SNR region , in ( 8 ) is large , and the ratio of the second path metric to the first tends to be small , which results in a small number of retained nodes at each layer in the proposed AKSD scheme .
#Text=Figure 4
#Text=illustrates the comparison of the average number of visited nodes for a MIMO system with , and 16-QAM .
#Text=Similar to
#Text=Figure 3

#Text=, it is seen that the proposed AKSD scheme provides significant complexity reduction compared to the other existing schemes that provide comparable performances , i. e. , the conventional KSD and IKSD .
#Text=The complexity reduction ratio of the AKSD at SNR dB with respect to the conventional KSD with is approximately .
#Text=Furthermore , at SNR dB , the AKSD scheme achieves approximately and complexity reduction compared to the adaptive threshold-based IKSD and fixed threshold-based IKSD with , respectively .
